page.title: 10TRAFFIC IN OUR VILLAGE
page.content: Up until 1984 there have been quite a number of road accidents on the A18 which passes through the village. This was due to the very bad bends in the road. In the past we sometimes carried out a traffic survey and it was quite difficult to keep a record as there was so much traffic on the road. The new motorway to Grimsby was opened in 1983 and much of the traffic now uses that routeway. The village has now become much quieter so much so that it is no longer possible to carry out a traffic survey due to absence of vehicles. The effect on local trade as a result must be considerable. The New Inn, the only pub in the village must have felt the effects of the new routeway quite considerably as it relied to a large extent on the passing trade. The residents think it a blessing.
